text: Hello, how are you all? Welcome to Chai or Code and we are continuing our Django series. It's going well and you all supported us a lot. A lot of people are sharing and being stingy but what can we do about it? But thank you so much for those who shared and those who help us achieve our target in the comments Thank you for those who comment and those who are not doing anything then what can we say about them? Let's talk to you because you are the ones who promote this channel on Twitter and LinkedIn and we are growing with a lot of growth So in this video let's move ahead in our Django series There were some people who were spreading rumors that Sir has ended the Django series What? Yes, we will end it when we come and tell you Anyways, you all already know me those who follow me regularly So what will we do in this video? In this video, we will take Django one step ahead. If you remember we had read about Django's models and retrieved data from those models and deployed it on the front end Many of you have made really good cards and shared them on Twitter and LinkedIn So those who do this and are working and engaging those people can work and the rest are sitting on the sofa so you should also work In this video, we are talking about relational databases Django is mostly with SQL databases Right now we are using SQLite but the same interface is used for MySQL, Postgres or any other SQL databases Django gives you a wrapper through which you can talk to the database and not directly and this is a good thing that the database can be replaced under the hood In this video, we will talk about relations the one to many relations of the database and how all these relations can be used in the work We will see it in the code directly so that things are easy After that, we will show you the admin interface and will also show you the customization of the admin interface and finally, we will introduce you to forms which is a new topic but you will enjoy how Django handles forms and how you get built-in forms You just need to write their CSS and your work is done So let's start Comment target? Yes, thank you so much for asking It is not much, it is a target of 400 comments As soon as the target of 400 comments then only the new video will come Let's see how much time it takes If it takes a week, then the video will come after a week If it takes 3 days, then the video will come after 3 days So it depends on how fast you get 400 comments completed Because if there is no engagement then make some other kind of videos So you take care of that thing So let's share the screen with you So let's share the screen with you Now let's see how we can handle it This is our application Let's open it We are running it in Python So first of all we activate the virtual environment We should see the virtual environment We should see the virtual environment ls-la ls-la Is our virtual environment deleted? Oh nice! Our virtual environment is deleted Let's see What happened to us? Ok, we are back Actually I opened the wrong folder So I fixed the folder And now we can see that we have our virtual environment By the way, for those who don't know that we have launched a new website docs.chaicode.com Some people had a problem with this that what is the big deal in this new documentation Ok, you don't have to see it So now you can get the attached documentation of this video You can see the whole section of Django When you are watching this video you will see a new tab Just click on it And you will get all the documentation along with the detailed guide and source code So you don't have to worry You will get all the documentation Will you get a good habit of reading the documentation? not that we can Innovate anything randomly It is a framework We have to follow guidelines And there are guidelines to learn the framework So first we will talk about relationships We will not talk about form now We will talk about it later So first We are talking about relationships There are not many relationships in SQL First is one to many Second is many to many And then one to one Now you have two models Or two entities Like tea and review Now what can be the relation Between tea and review One tea can have multiple reviews One review can't have multiple teas So we have to see What can
